data.title: Debrief: Everything you need to know about the King’s Speech
data.meta_description: POLITICO’s team of POLITICO Pro policy editors join U.K. Editor Jack Blanchard online to unpack what was in the King’s Speech and what this tells us about the incoming Labour government. They’ll di…
data.text:
Jack Blanchard is POLITICO’s U.K. Editor and co-host of the podcast Politics at Jack and Sam’s. Jack previously spent three years as the founding editor of POLITICO’s London Playbook morning newsletter, which he launched in September 2017. He subsequently spent two years as POLITICO’s U.K. Political Editor, launching and hosting the Westminster Insider podcast. Prior to joining POLITICO he was Political Editor of the Daily Mirror, overseeing all political output for one of Britain’s best-selling newspapers. During his years in the Mirror’s politics team Jack covered two U.K. general elections, the referendums on Brexit and Scottish independence, and all the extraordinary fall-out. In 2016 he also toured the USA and Austria covering each country’s respective Presidential elections. Jack has reported from major summits around the world including the G7, G20, NATO and CHOGM, and travelled with the Prime Minister on visits to Washington D.C., China, Japan, Afghanistan and right across Europe and the Middle East. He is a regular broadcast commentator on the BBC, Sky News, Times Radio and TalkTV. Before his arrival in Parliament in 2012, Jack spent seven years working for local and regional newspapers around the U.K. Having started out as a trainee at a small weekly paper in Lincolnshire called the Boston Standard, he worked his way up to become Political Editor of the Yorkshire Post, one of the country’s biggest regional papers. Jack is originally from Stockport on the southern edge of Greater Manchester, but now lives in south London with his wife Emily and two young children. He has a bachelor’s degree in history from University College London.

Fiona Maxwell is UK Finance Editor at POLITICO in London. She returned to POLITICO after five years working at the Bank of England and most recently as a chief correspondent for MLex in London. Fiona has spent her career covering post-crisis financial regulation, beginning at Risk.net in London before making her mark at POLITICO as our financial regulation reporter from 2016 to 2018. Fiona grew up in London and holds a degree from the University of Nottingham in modern languages. She speaks French, German and Spanish.

Oscar Williams is U.K. Tech and Trade Editor at POLITICO. He joined the London office in February 2023 from the New Statesman, where he was Technology Editor. Oscar has covered the tech sector for nearly a decade, reporting on privacy and security, competition in digital markets and industry lobbying. A UK-NZ dual citizen, Oscar grew up in the West Midlands and studied at the University of Nottingham and City, University of London. Prior to the New Statesman, he worked for the Guardian and HuffPost.

Russell Hargrave is POLITICO’s U.K. Energy and Climate Editor. Russ has most recently worked as a senior reporter for Third Sector, a magazine covering charities and social enterprises in the U.K. He spent the early part of his career as a freelance reporter where his work focused on Brexit, the Grenfell Tower tragedy, and the impact of international development funding cuts. He is also the author of a book on U.K. immigration policy. Russ grew up in Cardiff and holds a degree from Oxford University.
